actions.text:
*A Friendly Chat*

Talk to your children about something that they are interested in! üòÉ

‚öΩ An easy way to start talking to your children is to ask them about something they are interested in. For example, you could talk about local stories, traditions, sports, favourite books, friends, music, famous people or something they have been learning about.

üëÇ You may not find everything your children share to be interesting, but it‚Äôs important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn. 

Paying attention to what matters to your children can make a big difference in your relationship and their happiness.

actions.text:
*Reflect on Hope*

Spread Hope! 

üí° Together, take a minute to think about all the things you did today. 

‚òÄÔ∏è Take turns sharing one positive thing that happened. This could be something small or big, like feeling good because you took a pause to take some deep breaths, exercised like walking or stretching, or spent time with people you care about.

‚è∞ Try doing this every day - even more on the days it feels like you have not done anything special.

actions.text:
*What‚Äôs New?*

Learning is fun! üéì

‚ùì Ask your children to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together. 
For example, keeping a ball in the air with your foot, learning and practising local language phrases, sharing stories from your culture, playing local games and sports, or learning a new song.

üîÑ Take turns trying out the new skill. Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!
üíõ Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your children or yourself for your ability in the skill.

ŸÖÿ´ŸÑŸãÿßÿå ÿ™ÿÆŸÑŸàÿß ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ±ÿ© ÿ´ÿßÿ®ÿ™ÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑŸáŸàÿßÿ° ÿ®ÿ±ÿ¨ŸÑŸäŸÉŸÖÿå ÿ™ÿ™ÿπŸÑŸÖŸàÿß Ÿàÿ™ÿ™ŸÖÿ±ŸÜŸàÿß ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿπÿ®ÿßÿ±ÿßÿ™ ŸÖŸÜ ŸÑŸáÿ¨ÿ™ŸÜÿßÿå ÿ™ÿ¥ÿßÿ±ŸÉŸàÿß ŸÇÿµÿµ ŸÖŸÜ ÿ´ŸÇÿßŸÅÿ™ŸÉŸÖÿå ÿ™ŸÑÿπÿ®Ÿàÿß ÿ£ŸÑÿπÿßÿ® Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂ÿßÿ™ ÿ®ŸÑÿßÿØŸÜÿßÿå ÿ£Ÿà ÿ™ÿ™ÿπŸÑŸÖŸàÿß ÿ£ÿ∫ŸÜŸäÿ© ÿ¨ÿØŸäÿØÿ©.

üîÑÿ®ÿØŸëŸÑŸàÿß ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿØŸàÿßÿ± Ÿàÿ¨ÿ±ÿ®Ÿàÿß ÿßŸÑŸÖŸáÿßÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ¨ÿØŸäÿØÿ©. ÿ™ÿ£ŸÉÿØŸàÿß ÿ£ŸÜŸÉŸÖ ÿ™ŸÖÿØÿ≠Ÿàÿß ÿ®ÿπÿ∂ Ÿàÿ™ÿ™ÿπŸÑŸÖŸàÿß Ÿàÿ™ŸÑÿπÿ®Ÿàÿß ŸÖÿπ ÿ®ÿπÿ∂!
üíõÿ™ÿπÿßŸÖŸÑ ŸÖÿπ ÿ™ÿπŸÑŸÖ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸáÿßÿ±ÿ© ÿ®ÿ∑ÿ±ŸäŸÇÿ© ŸÑÿ∑ŸäŸÅÿ© ŸàŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿπÿ©ÿå ŸàŸÖÿß ÿ™ÿ≠ŸÉŸÖ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉ ÿ£Ÿà ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿ≠ÿßŸÑŸÉ ÿ®ÿ≥ÿ®ÿ® ŸÇÿØÿ±ÿ™ŸÉ Ÿàÿ™ŸÖŸÉŸÜ ŸÖŸáÿßÿ±ÿ™ŸÉ.

actions.text:
*Check-in Chat*

Actively checking in on one another helps to keep relationships healthy! ‚≠ê
Ask each other questions like: ‚ÄúWhat made you happy today?‚Äù üëÇ ‚ÄúWhat was difficult today?‚Äù üëÇ ‚ÄúHow can I help you?‚Äù üëÇ
For this to help, your children need to feel safe while sharing things with you. Be open to their responses. üíö

Older children tend to be more honest when they trust that what they say will not be used against them later.
Be kind to yourself if your children do not want to share their problems with you. üíô Often, children are afraid to share as they are scared they will get in trouble. Getting upset with them won‚Äôt help - keep showing you love them and give them time! üå∑

ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ®ÿßÿ± ÿ≥ŸÜŸãŸëÿß ÿ®ŸäŸÉŸàŸÜŸàÿß ÿ£ÿµÿØŸÇ ŸÑŸÖÿß ÿ®Ÿäÿ´ŸÇŸàÿß ÿ•ŸÜŸá ÿßŸÑŸÑŸä ÿ®Ÿäÿ≠ŸÉŸàŸá ŸÖÿß ÿ±ÿßÿ≠ Ÿäÿ≥ÿ™ÿπŸÖŸÑ ÿ∂ÿØŸáŸÖ ÿ®ÿπÿØŸäŸÜ.
ŸÉŸàŸÜ ŸÑÿ∑ŸäŸÅ ŸÖÿπ ÿ≠ÿßŸÑŸÉ ÿ•ÿ∞ÿß ÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉ ŸÖÿß ÿ®ÿØŸáŸÖ Ÿäÿ≠ŸÉŸàŸÑŸÉ ŸÖÿ¥ÿßŸÉŸÑŸáŸÖ. üíô ÿ∫ÿßŸÑÿ®Ÿãÿß ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑ ÿ®ŸäÿÆÿßŸÅŸàÿß Ÿäÿ≠ŸÉŸàÿß ŸÑÿ£ŸÜŸáŸÖ ÿ®ŸäÿÆÿßŸÅŸàÿß Ÿäÿ™Ÿàÿ±ÿ∑Ÿàÿß ÿ®ŸÖÿ¥ÿßŸÉŸÑ. ÿßŸÑÿ≤ÿπŸÑ ŸÖŸÜŸáŸÖ ŸÖÿß ÿ±ÿßÿ≠ ŸäŸÅŸäÿØ - ÿ£ÿ∏Ÿáÿ± ŸÑŸáŸÖ ÿ•ŸÜŸÉ ÿ®ÿ™ÿ≠ÿ®ŸáŸÖ Ÿàÿßÿπÿ∑ŸäŸáŸÖ ŸàŸÇÿ™! üå∑"

actions.text:
*Express Yourself*

Movement makes people happy!
This game can be played in pairs or as a group - stand facing each other or in a circle.
üéµ Together, choose a song, a fun sound, or a clapping pattern to follow and choose a person to start the game by creating one movement.
üëÄ The person to their right must copy that movement and add their own movement to it.
‚ú® Go around the circle, each person adding a new movement.

üîÑ The first one who forgets someone's movements or does it in the wrong order chooses the next song, sound, or pattern and starts the game again.

üéâ Have fun trying out different movements together with this fun game.

text:
*ÿπÿ®ÿ± ÿπŸÜ ŸÜŸÅÿ≥ŸÉ*

ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ±ŸÉÿ© ÿ®ÿ™ÿÆŸÑŸä ÿßŸÑŸÜÿßÿ≥ ŸÖÿ®ÿ≥Ÿàÿ∑ÿ©!
ŸäŸÖŸÉŸÜ ŸÑÿπÿ® ŸáÿßŸä ÿßŸÑŸÑÿπÿ®ÿ© ŸÉÿ£ÿ≤Ÿàÿßÿ¨ ÿ£Ÿà ŸÉŸÖÿ¨ŸÖŸàÿπÿ© - ÿßŸÑŸàŸÇŸàŸÅ ŸÇÿØÿßŸÖ ÿ®ÿπÿ∂ ÿ£Ÿà ŸÅŸä ÿ¥ŸÉŸÑ ÿØÿßŸäÿ±ÿ©.
üéµ ŸÖÿπ ÿ®ÿπÿ∂ÿå ÿßÿÆÿ™ÿßÿ±Ÿàÿß ÿ£ÿ∫ŸÜŸäÿ©ÿå ÿ£Ÿà ÿµŸàÿ™ ŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿπÿå ÿ£Ÿà ŸÜŸÖÿ∑ ÿ™ÿµŸÅŸäŸÇ ÿ™ÿ™ÿ®ÿπŸàŸáÿå ŸàÿßÿÆÿ™ÿßÿ±Ÿàÿß ÿ¥ÿÆÿµ Ÿäÿ®ÿØÿ£ ÿßŸÑŸÑÿπÿ®ÿ© ÿ®ÿ≠ÿ±ŸÉÿ© Ÿàÿßÿ≠ÿØÿ©.
üëÄ ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿÆÿµ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸä ÿπŸÑŸâ ŸäŸÖŸäŸÜŸá ŸÑÿßÿ≤ŸÖ ŸäŸÇŸÑÿØ ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ±ŸÉÿ© ŸáÿßÿØŸä ŸàŸäÿ∂ŸäŸÅ ÿ≠ÿ±ŸÉÿ™Ÿá ÿßŸÑÿÆÿßÿµÿ©.
‚ú® ŸÑŸÅŸàÿß ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿØÿßŸäÿ±ÿ©ÿå ŸàŸÉŸÑ ÿ¥ÿÆÿµ Ÿäÿ∂ŸäŸÅ ÿ≠ÿ±ŸÉÿ© ÿ¨ÿØŸäÿØÿ©.

üîÑ ÿ£ŸàŸÑ Ÿàÿßÿ≠ÿØ ŸäŸÜÿ≥Ÿâ ÿ≠ÿ±ŸÉÿ© ÿ≠ÿØÿß ÿ£Ÿà ŸäÿπŸÖŸÑŸáÿß ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ±ÿ™Ÿäÿ® ÿßŸÑÿ∫ŸÑÿ∑ ŸáŸà ÿßŸÑŸÑŸä ŸäÿÆÿ™ÿßÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ∫ŸÜŸäÿ©ÿå ÿ£Ÿà ÿßŸÑÿµŸàÿ™ÿå ÿ£Ÿà ÿßŸÑŸÜŸÖÿ∑ ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿßŸÑŸä ŸàŸäÿ®ÿØÿ£ ÿßŸÑŸÑÿπÿ®ÿ© ŸÖŸÜ ÿ¨ÿØŸäÿØ.

üéâ ÿßÿ≥ÿ™ŸÖÿ™ÿπŸàÿß ŸÖÿπ ÿ®ÿπÿ∂ Ÿàÿ¨ÿ±ÿ®Ÿàÿß ÿ≠ÿ±ŸÉÿßÿ™ ŸÖÿÆÿ™ŸÑŸÅÿ© ŸÖÿπ Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÑÿπÿ®ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿπÿ©.

actions.text:
*2 Truths, 1 Lie*

This is a fun, quick game, and the point of it is to learn things about each other. Make your answers as interesting as possible! üé®
üí° Everyone thinks of 3 facts about themselves. 2 must be true, and 1 must be a lie. 
üî∑ Here are some examples: I hate cold weather, I love cold ice cream, and my favourite thing to learn about is maths.
üëÄ Share your facts with your children and ask them to guess which one is a lie. 
üîÑ Now ask them to do the same, and guess theirs.
Did you learn anything new about your children, or did they learn anything new about you? üíõ

ÿ¥ÿßÿ±ŸÉŸà ÿßŸÑÿ≠ŸÇÿßÿ¶ŸÇ ŸÖÿπ ÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉŸÖ Ÿàÿßÿ∑ŸÑÿ®Ÿàÿß ŸÖŸÜŸáŸÖ ŸäÿÆŸÖŸÜŸàÿß ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ∞ÿ®ÿ©.
ŸàÿØŸÑŸàŸÇÿ™Ÿä ÿßÿ∑ŸÑÿ®Ÿàÿß ŸÖŸÜŸáŸÖ ŸäÿπŸÖŸÑŸàÿß ŸÜŸÅÿ≥ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿ¥Ÿäÿå ŸàÿÆŸÖŸÜŸàÿß ÿ≠ŸÇÿßÿ¶ŸÇŸáŸÖ.
ŸáŸÑ ÿ™ÿπŸÑŸÖÿ™Ÿàÿß ÿ•ÿ¥Ÿä ÿ¨ÿØŸäÿØ ÿπŸÜ ÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉŸÖ ÿ£Ÿà ÿ™ÿπŸÑŸÖŸàÿß ÿ•ÿ¥Ÿä ÿ¨ÿØŸäÿØ ÿπŸÜŸÉŸÖÿü

actions.text:
*Yes, No or Maybe*

Are you tired of hearing your children say yes, no, or maybe to all of your questions? Turn your chat into a game, and don‚Äôt allow one-word answers. üéà

üî¥ Older children are known to give one-word answers to avoid talking. 
üí° When you would like to really know how your children are doing, you can turn your chat into a game. 
‚≠ê Take turns asking each other questions. The only rule is that you cannot use one-word responses like Yes, No, Maybe, Fine, and Okay.
‚öΩ You can ask about things your children like or what they did today. For example, how was your day? What are you excited about? What is one thing that is worrying you today?
üîÑ It is important to let your children ask you questions as well. Trust is built when your children can see that you are also sharing your life with them and not only trying to learn about their life.

text:
ŸÜÿπŸÖÿå ÿ£Ÿà ŸÑÿß ÿ£Ÿà ŸäŸÖŸÉŸÜ

ÿ≤ŸáŸÇÿ™Ÿàÿß ŸÖŸÜ ÿ•ÿ¨ÿßÿ®ÿ© ÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉŸÖ ÿ®ŸÜÿπŸÖÿå ŸÑÿßÿå ŸäŸÖŸÉŸÜ ÿπŸÑŸâ ŸÉŸÑ ÿ£ÿ≥ÿ¶ŸÑÿ™ŸÉŸÖÿü ÿ≠ŸàŸÑŸàÿß ÿØÿ±ÿØÿ¥ÿ™ŸÉŸÖ ŸÑŸÑÿπÿ®ÿ©ÿå ŸàŸÖÿß ÿ™ÿ≥ŸÖÿ≠Ÿàÿß ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿ¨ÿßÿ®ÿ© ÿ®ŸÉŸÑŸÖÿ© Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ©.

ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ®ÿßÿ± ŸÖÿπÿ±ŸàŸÅŸäŸÜ ÿ•ŸÜŸáŸÖ ÿ®Ÿäÿπÿ∑Ÿàÿß ÿ•ÿ¨ÿßÿ®ÿßÿ™ ÿ®ŸÉŸÑŸÖÿ© Ÿàÿßÿ≠ÿØÿ© ÿπÿ¥ÿßŸÜ Ÿäÿ™ÿ¨ŸÜÿ®Ÿàÿß ÿßŸÑÿ≠ŸÉŸä.
ŸÑŸà ÿ®ÿØŸÉ ÿ™ÿπÿ±ŸÅ ÿπŸÜ ÿ¨ÿØ ŸÉŸäŸÅ ÿ≠ÿßŸÑ ÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉÿå ŸÖŸÖŸÉŸÜ ÿ™ÿ≠ŸàŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿØÿ±ÿØÿ¥ÿ© ŸÖÿπŸáŸÖ ŸÑŸÑÿπÿ®ÿ©.
ÿ®ÿØŸëŸÑŸàÿß ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿØŸàÿßÿ± Ÿàÿßÿ≥ÿ£ŸÑŸàÿß ÿ®ÿπÿ∂ ÿ£ÿ≥ÿ¶ŸÑÿ©. ÿßŸÑŸÇÿßÿπÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑŸàÿ≠ŸäÿØÿ© ÿ•ŸÜŸÉŸÖ ŸÖÿß ÿ™ÿ≥ÿ™ÿπŸÖŸÑŸàÿß ÿ•ÿ¨ÿßÿ®ÿßÿ™ ÿ®ŸÉŸÑŸÖÿ© Ÿàÿßÿ≠ÿØÿ© ŸÖÿ´ŸÑ ŸÜÿπŸÖÿå ÿ£Ÿà ŸÑÿßÿå ÿ£Ÿà ŸäŸÖŸÉŸÜÿå ÿ£Ÿà ŸÖŸÜŸäÿ≠ÿå ÿ£Ÿà ÿ™ŸÖÿßŸÖ
ŸÖŸÖŸÉŸÜ ÿ™ÿ≥ÿ£ŸÑ ÿπŸÜ ÿ¥ÿ∫ŸÑÿßÿ™ ÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉ ÿ®Ÿäÿ≠ÿ®ŸàŸáÿß ÿ£Ÿà ÿ¥Ÿà ÿπŸÖŸÑŸàÿß ÿßŸÑŸÜŸáÿßÿ±ÿØŸá. ŸÖÿ´ŸÑŸãÿßÿå ŸÉŸäŸÅ ŸÉÿßŸÜ ŸäŸàŸÖŸÉÿü ÿ¥Ÿà ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿ¥Ÿä ÿßŸÑŸÑŸä ŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÖÿ≥ŸäŸÜ ŸÑŸäŸáÿü ÿ¥Ÿà ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿ¥Ÿä ÿßŸÑŸÑŸä ŸÖŸÇŸÑŸÇŸÉŸÖ ÿßŸÑŸÜŸáÿßÿ±ÿØŸá
ŸÖŸáŸÖ ÿ•ŸÜŸÉ ÿ™ÿÆŸÑŸä ÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉ Ÿäÿ≥ÿ£ŸÑŸàŸÉ ŸÉŸÖÿßŸÜ. ÿßŸÑÿ´ŸÇÿ© ÿ®ÿ™ŸÜÿ®ŸÜŸä ŸÑŸÖÿß ÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉ Ÿäÿ¥ŸàŸÅŸàÿß ÿ•ŸÜŸÉ ÿ®ÿ™ÿ¥ÿßÿ±ŸÉ ÿ≠Ÿäÿßÿ™ŸÉ ŸÖÿπŸáŸÖÿå ŸÖÿ¥ ÿ®ÿ≥ ÿ®ÿ™ÿ≠ÿßŸàŸÑ ÿ™ÿπÿ±ŸÅ ÿ£ŸÉÿ™ÿ± ÿπŸÜ ÿ≠Ÿäÿßÿ™ŸáŸÖ.

actions.text:
*Get Active*

Exercise is a great way to spend time together, and it is so good for your healthüå±. Find an exercise activity that both you and your children want to do and try it out together! Be mindful of the safety of the space you are using for exercise. 

‚è∞ Even walking for 10 minutes a day is good for you. 
‚öΩTogether, try walking, running, stretching, playing games like hide-and-seek, or any other physical activities you enjoy.

üèÜ Together, think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you run to a certain point? Take turns being the coach? Can there be a small, free reward like getting to decide the next activity?
Exercise becomes easier and more enjoyable the more you do it. 
üîÑ If you or your children do not like the first type of exercise you pick, try a new way to exercise.

text:
ÿ™ÿ≠ÿ±ŸëŸÉŸàÿß

ŸÖŸÖÿßÿ±ÿ≥ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂ÿ© ÿ∑ÿ±ŸäŸÇÿ© ŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿßÿ≤ÿ© ÿ™ŸÇÿ∂Ÿàÿß ŸÅŸäŸáÿß ŸàŸÇÿ™ ŸÖÿπ ÿ®ÿπÿ∂ÿå ŸàŸáŸä ŸÉÿ™Ÿäÿ± ŸÖŸÜŸäÿ≠ÿ© ŸÑÿµÿ≠ÿ™ŸÉŸÖ. ÿØŸàŸëŸéÿ± ÿπŸÑŸâ ŸÜÿ¥ÿßÿ∑ ÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂Ÿä ÿ£ŸÜÿ™ Ÿàÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉ ÿ®ÿØŸÉŸÖ ÿ™ÿπŸÖŸÑŸàŸá Ÿàÿ¨ÿ±ÿ®ŸàŸá ŸÖÿπŸãÿß! ÿßŸÜÿ™ÿ®Ÿá ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿ£ŸÖÿßŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÉÿßŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸä ÿ®ÿ™ÿ≥ÿ™ÿÆÿØŸÖŸàŸá ŸÑŸÑÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂ÿ©.

ÿ≠ÿ™Ÿâ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ¥Ÿä ŸÑŸÖÿØÿ© 10 ÿØŸÇÿßŸäŸÇ ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸäŸàŸÖ ŸÖŸÜŸäÿ≠ ŸÑŸÉŸÖ.

actions.text:
*Take a Pause With Your Children*

Take a pause with your children. This helps them deal with stress in a healthy way!
‚è∞ You could take a pause together at any time, or you could try at a specific time like before bedtime.
üëÇ Sit down together and close your eyes. Listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. 
‚≠ê Take 5 more deep breaths.

*Take a Pause With Your Children*

Take a pause with your children. This helps them deal with stress in a healthy way!
‚è∞ You could take a pause together at any time, or you could try at a specific time like before bedtime.
üëÇ Sit down together and close your eyes. Listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. 
‚≠ê Take 5 more deep breaths.

üëÄ When you are ready, open your eyes again. Do you feel any different? 
‚è∏ Ask your children what it was like to take a pause. Listen and accept whatever they say about it.

actions.text:
*This Is Who I Am*

Self-esteem is the way you value yourself, either in a positive or negative way. Helping your children have high self-esteem is a recipe for success! üèÜ
‚≠êShare with your children 3 things you like about yourself!
3Ô∏è‚É£ Ask your children to tell you 3 things they like about themselves.
For example, I am great at treating others kindly. I am great at playing football. I am great at drawing flowers. If this is too hard, try thinking of just one thing.

*ŸáÿßÿØ ŸáŸà ÿ£ŸÜÿß*

ŸÖÿ´ŸÑŸãÿßÿå ÿ£ŸÜÿß ŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿßÿ≤ ŸÅŸä ŸÖÿπÿßŸÖŸÑÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÜÿßÿ≥ ÿ®ŸÑÿ∑ŸÅ. ÿ£ŸÜÿß ŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿßÿ≤ ŸÅŸä ŸÑÿπÿ® ŸÉÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÇÿØŸÖ. ÿ£ŸÜÿß ŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿßÿ≤ ŸÅŸä ÿ±ÿ≥ŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ≤ŸáŸàÿ±. ŸÑŸà ŸáÿßŸä ŸÉÿßŸÜ ÿµÿπÿ®ÿå ÿ≠ÿßŸàŸÑŸàÿß ÿ™ŸÅŸÉŸëÿ±Ÿàÿß ŸÅŸä ÿ•ÿ¥Ÿä Ÿàÿßÿ≠ÿØ ÿ®ÿ≥.

actions.text:
*Weekly Goal Setting*

Let‚Äôs set some goals ‚≠ê

‚è∞ It can be helpful to set smaller weekly goals that are easier to reach, especially when life feels uncertain. 
 
üí°Ask each of your children for one goal that they would like to achieve this week. 

üîÑ Make sure this goal is *specific* and *achievable* to reach in 1 week, like: practising deep breathing for 5 minutes every day, exercising for 10 minutes three times a week, journaling feelings every night, or spending quality time with family or friends daily.

üíö You can also share your own weekly goals with your children and support each other so you can both achieve your goals.

üéâ Make sure to praise and celebrate your children for their hard work towards reaching their goals.

üîî If your children do not reach their goals, that is okay. Discuss with them the steps they still need to take or how they could reach it a different way.

ÿ™ÿ£ŸÉÿØ ÿ•ŸÜ ŸáÿßŸä ÿßŸÑŸáÿØŸÅ *ŸÖÿ≠ÿØÿØ* Ÿà*ŸÇÿßÿ®ŸÑ ŸÑŸÑÿ™ÿ≠ŸÇŸäŸÇ* ÿÆŸÑÿßŸÑ ÿ£ÿ≥ÿ®Ÿàÿπÿå ŸÖÿ´ŸÑ Ÿäÿ™ŸÖÿ±ŸÜŸàÿß ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑÿ™ŸÜŸÅÿ≥ ÿ®ÿπŸÖŸÇ 5 ÿØŸÇÿßŸäŸÇ ŸÉŸÑ ŸäŸàŸÖÿå ÿ£Ÿà Ÿäÿ™ŸÖÿ±ŸÜŸàÿß ÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂ÿ© 10 ÿØŸÇÿßŸäŸÇ 3 ŸÖÿ±ÿßÿ™ ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ÿ®Ÿàÿπÿå ÿ£Ÿà ŸäŸÉÿ™ÿ®Ÿàÿß ŸÖÿ¥ÿßÿπÿ±ŸáŸÖ ÿ®ŸÖÿ∞ŸÉÿ±ÿßÿ™ ŸÉŸÑ ŸÑŸäŸÑÿ©ÿå ÿ£Ÿà ŸäŸÇÿ∂Ÿàÿß ŸàŸÇÿ™ ŸÖŸÖŸäÿ≤ ŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑÿπÿßÿ¶ŸÑÿ© ÿ£Ÿà ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿµÿ≠ÿßÿ® ŸÉŸÑ ŸäŸàŸÖ.

actions.text:
*One-on-One Time*

üíö Spending time just with your children and taking an interest in them can improve your relationship. 

üëÄ When your children are playing alone or occupying themselves, join them and show interest in what they are doing.

üëÇAsk questions about their activity and listen to them.

Let your children lead the activity and follow them to build their confidence and autonomy. üòÉ

üëÄ Say what you see - describing everything and supporting your children‚Äôs actions.

Be positive, praise your children and enjoy spending this time with them. üòÉüíö

ÿÆŸÑŸä ÿ£ÿ∑ŸÅÿßŸÑŸÉ ŸäŸÇŸàÿØŸàÿß ÿßŸÑŸÜÿ¥ÿßÿ∑ Ÿàÿßÿ™ÿ®ÿπŸáŸÖ ŸÑŸäÿ≤ŸäÿØŸàÿß ÿ´ŸÇÿ™ŸáŸÖ ÿ®ŸÜŸÅÿ≥ŸáŸÖ Ÿàÿßÿ≥ÿ™ŸÇŸÑÿßŸÑŸäÿ™ŸáŸÖ. üòÉ

actions.text:
*Animals*

üß∏ *Active Animals* 
Take turns with your children doing animal actions. You might hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, or flap like a bird. Add your own actions and animals!

üí°*All the Animals We Can Think Of* 
Think about groups of animals and talk about them with your children! 
What are all the animals we can think of that have feathers? What are all the animals we can think of that eat plants? üå± What animals can we think of that lay eggs?

For example:
Hop twice, turn around.
Take ten steps forward, three steps to the side and sit down. ‚úÖ

actions.text:
You are not alone ü§≤. Many other people are also going through very hard times, including war or having to leave their homes üíî. Many people share your pain as you face so many losses and uncertainties.

When life is this hard, it's normal to feel overwhelmed üò£.

Today‚Äôs tips are about ways you can take care of yourself üå±, even when it is very difficult.
Remember, when you take good care of yourself, it can help you take good care of your children.

Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 3Ô∏è‚É£ tips to help you care for yourself so you can care for your children: 
1Ô∏è‚É£ *BREATHE*
2Ô∏è‚É£ *BREATHE TOGETHER WITH YOUR CHILDREN*
3Ô∏è‚É£ *CONNECT AND SHARE*
Here are 3Ô∏è‚É£ tips to help:

1Ô∏è‚É£ *BREATHE*

Listen to your breath üå¨Ô∏è as it goes in and out.
Place your hands on your chest or tummy and feel how it rises and falls with each breath.
Then, listen to your breath in a calm, gentle way for a whileüåÑ.

2Ô∏è‚É£ *BREATHE TOGETHER WITH YOUR CHILDREN*

 üóìÔ∏è Do these breathing practices every day together with your children. It will help you and them learn to manage stress üå±.

3Ô∏è‚É£ *CONNECT AND SHARE*

If your stress feels overwhelming, please contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline. Type HELP after these tips for more information.

üíô Thank you for joining us today. You are truly great.
Coping with your fears and stresses üåä is the first step to caring for yourself üí™ and helping others ü§ù.

actions.text:
In these times, it can be hard for us as parents to help our children feel secure.

Today's tips are about helping your children cope with trauma from war, displacement, and other hardships üåçüíî.

It is possible that your children are feeling upset, angry, or confused. They need your support.

There are some simple things you can do! üåü

Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how you can support your children during these tough times: 
1Ô∏è‚É£ *LISTEN*
2Ô∏è‚É£ *ACCEPT & BE SENSITIVE*
3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE HONEST*
4Ô∏è‚É£ *PRAISE YOURSELF AND YOUR CHILDREN*
5Ô∏è‚É£ *THERE IS HELP*
Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how you can support your children during these times:

1Ô∏è‚É£ *LISTEN*

üëÇ Listen to your children carefully when they express their feelings and try to empathise.

2Ô∏è‚É£ *ACCEPT & BE SENSITIVE*

üå± Accept whatever they are feeling and give them comfort that such feelings are quite normal under these circumstances.

üõë If your children do not want to talk about this situation, do not insist.

3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE HONEST*

If your children ask a question about what is happening, be honest in your response and share information that is appropriate for their age.

Try to have a compassionate attitude and accept any feelings they have.

4Ô∏è‚É£ *PRAISE YOURSELF AND YOUR CHILDREN*

üåü Every night, praise yourself and your children for something, however small. 

This will make you and your children feel better and will help build a caring relationship between you ü¶ã.

5Ô∏è‚É£ *THERE IS HELP*

ü§ùIf you have any concerns regarding a child‚Äôs feelings and behaviours, then please contact a trusted person, organisation, or helpline. Type HELP after these tips, or any time you need help, for more information.
Thank you for joining us today üíô. No matter how upset or tired you are, you are amazing parents.

actions.text: Today's tips are about practical ways to cope during difficult times.
Even though it‚Äôs hard, try to practise simple daily habits üóìÔ∏è because routines help children feel secure.

Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 5Ô∏è‚É£ practical, daily habits you can do every day that will help you and your children cope with your current situation:  
1Ô∏è‚É£ *SPEND TIME TOGETHER*
2Ô∏è‚É£ *ASK YOUR CHILDREN*
3Ô∏è‚É£ *APPRECIATE YOUR CHILDREN*
4Ô∏è‚É£ *HELP OTHERS*
5Ô∏è‚É£ *BE PRESENT*
Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips for building practical habits you can do every day that will help you and your children cope with your current situation:

1Ô∏è‚É£ *SPEND TIME TOGETHER*

If it is possible, try to make a routine for spending time together üïí. 

üîÅ You can engage children in daily activities, such as telling a story, praying together, or sharing at least one meal together.

Here are 4Ô∏è‚É£ tips that can help you cope with negative emotions and also encourage your children:

1Ô∏è‚É£ *SHARE YOUR FEELINGS*

When you are feeling stress, tension or anger, find someone who you can share your feelings with, like a family member or friend.

Avoid substance abuse as a stress coping mechanism. 
 
If your stress feels overwhelming, you can contact an organization or helpline for extra support. Type HELP after these tips for more informationü§≤.

2Ô∏è‚É£ *BREATHE*

When you feel extremely angry, take a ten-second break or pause before you engage with anyone, including your children ‚è∏Ô∏è.
Take five deep breathsüå¨Ô∏è.
Then try to respond in a calmer way üïäÔ∏è.

3Ô∏è‚É£ *REASSURE YOUR CHILDREN*
It‚Äôs ok to show your concern and emotions to your children üí¨. This will help them learn about their own emotions. It‚Äôs also good to remind them that we believe that one day hope and justice will prevail ‚ú®.

Reassure your children that one day, war will end and our community will be able to rebuild and thrive together üåø.
Share stories with them of how people in the past have worked together and come out of traumatic situations üìñ.

4Ô∏è‚É£ *THERE ARE PEOPLE WHO CARE*

Assure your children that friends, relatives, or charitable organisations will try to find ways to help them in these situations ü§≤.
Thank you for being here with us today üíô. Be proud of yourself every time you manage your negative feelings and encourage your children. You are an amazing parent! ‚ú®

Here are 3Ô∏è‚É£ tips for protecting your children from harassment:

These tips are about helping your children in the case of loved ones dying. 

Losing a loved one is painful for everyone, including children. 

It is possible that your children appear to be happy but deep inside are sad.
Talking to your children about death can be hard, but it will help them make sense of what is happening.

Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how to help your children when loved ones die:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *TALK WITH CHILDREN* 
2Ô∏è‚É£ *LISTEN AND ACCEPT*
3Ô∏è‚É£ *SAY GOODBYE*
4Ô∏è‚É£ *NO BLAMING*
5Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CLEAR*
Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how to help your children when loved ones die:

1Ô∏è‚É£ *TALK WITH CHILDREN* 

Children often sense the pain of loss or death, even if they don't know yet what happened. 
Tell them in simple and honest words that the person has passed away. 
üíôBe sensitive to their emotions and try to create a compassionate space when you talk with them about the death of loved ones.

2Ô∏è‚É£ *LISTEN AND ACCEPT*

Listen to your children. Accept anything they are feeling and show them affection.

3Ô∏è‚É£ *SAY GOODBYE*

Do something together to say goodbye to the person who had died ‚Äì consider a prayer ü§≤ or a letter üìÉ.

4Ô∏è‚É£ *NO BLAMING*

Sometimes we feel like loss is our fault, even when it is not, and children may feel this way too. 
Many people have these feelings. Remind yourself it‚Äôs not your fault and help your children see it‚Äôs not their fault either üíô.

5Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CLEAR*

Tell children clearly who will be taking care of them now, if a change needs to happen.

Listen to your breath üå¨Ô∏è as it goes in and out.

 üóìÔ∏è Do these breathing practices every day together with your children. It will help you and them learn to manage stress üå±.

actions.text:
In these times, it can be hard for us as parents to help our children feel secure.

Today's tips are about helping your children cope with trauma from war, displacement, and other hardships üåçüíî.

It is possible that your children are feeling upset, angry, or confused. They need your support.

There are some simple things you can do! üåü

Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how you can support your children during these tough times: 
1Ô∏è‚É£ *LISTEN*
2Ô∏è‚É£ *ACCEPT & BE SENSITIVE*
3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE HONEST*
4Ô∏è‚É£ *PRAISE YOURSELF AND YOUR CHILDREN*
5Ô∏è‚É£ *THERE IS HELP*
Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how you can support your children during these times:

1Ô∏è‚É£ *LISTEN*

üëÇ Listen to your children carefully when they express their feelings and try to empathise.

2Ô∏è‚É£ *ACCEPT & BE SENSITIVE*

üå± Accept whatever they are feeling and give them comfort that such feelings are quite normal under these circumstances.

üõë If your children do not want to talk about this situation, do not insist.

3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE HONEST*

If your children ask a question about what is happening, be honest in your response and share information that is appropriate for their age.

Try to have a compassionate attitude and accept any feelings they have.

4Ô∏è‚É£ *PRAISE YOURSELF AND YOUR CHILDREN*

üåü Every night, praise yourself and your children for something, however small. 

This will make you and your children feel better and will help build a caring relationship between you ü¶ã.

5Ô∏è‚É£ *THERE IS HELP*

ü§ùIf you have any concerns regarding a child‚Äôs feelings and behaviours, then please contact a trusted person, organisation, or helpline. Type HELP after these tips, or any time you need help, for more information.

actions.text: In these times that are so hard, we often have extra stress and tension, and it‚Äôs normal that we feel more anger.

Here are 4Ô∏è‚É£ tips that can help you cope with negative emotions and also encourage your children:

1Ô∏è‚É£ *SHARE YOUR FEELINGS*

When you are feeling stress, tension or anger, find someone who you can share your feelings with, like a family member or friend.

Avoid substance abuse as a stress coping mechanism. 
 
If your stress feels overwhelming, you can contact an organization or helpline for extra support. Type HELP after these tips for more informationü§≤.

2Ô∏è‚É£ *BREATHE*

When you feel extremely angry, take a ten-second break or pause before you engage with anyone, including your children ‚è∏Ô∏è.
Take five deep breathsüå¨Ô∏è.
Then try to respond in a calmer way üïäÔ∏è.

3Ô∏è‚É£ *REASSURE YOUR CHILDREN*
It‚Äôs ok to show your concern and emotions to your children üí¨. This will help them learn about their own emotions. It‚Äôs also good to remind them that we believe that one day hope and justice will prevail ‚ú®.

Reassure your children that one day, war will end and our community will be able to rebuild and thrive together üåø.
Share stories with them of how people in the past have worked together and come out of traumatic situations üìñ.

4Ô∏è‚É£ *THERE ARE PEOPLE WHO CARE*

Assure your children that friends, relatives, or charitable organisations will try to find ways to help them in these situations ü§≤.

actions.text:
These tips are about helping your children in the case of loved ones dying. 

Losing a loved one is painful for everyone, including children. 

It is possible that your children appear to be happy but deep inside are sad.
Talking to your children about death can be hard, but it will help them make sense of what is happening.

Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how to help your children when loved ones die:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *TALK WITH CHILDREN* 
2Ô∏è‚É£ *LISTEN AND ACCEPT*
3Ô∏è‚É£ *SAY GOODBYE*
4Ô∏è‚É£ *NO BLAMING*
5Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CLEAR*
Here are 5Ô∏è‚É£ tips on how to help your children when loved ones die:

1Ô∏è‚É£ *TALK WITH CHILDREN* 

Children often sense the pain of loss or death, even if they don't know yet what happened. 
Tell them in simple and honest words that the person has passed away. 
üíôBe sensitive to their emotions and try to create a compassionate space when you talk with them about the death of loved ones.

2Ô∏è‚É£ *LISTEN AND ACCEPT*

Listen to your children. Accept anything they are feeling and show them affection.

3Ô∏è‚É£ *SAY GOODBYE*

Do something together to say goodbye to the person who had died ‚Äì consider a prayer ü§≤ or a letter üìÉ.

4Ô∏è‚É£ *NO BLAMING*

Sometimes we feel like loss is our fault, even when it is not, and children may feel this way too. 
Many people have these feelings. Remind yourself it‚Äôs not your fault and help your children see it‚Äôs not their fault either üíô.

5Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CLEAR*

Tell children clearly who will be taking care of them now, if a change needs to happen.

actions.text: Congratulations on reaching our final set of tips! üéâ Here we are talking about ways to build your and your children‚Äôs strength and to encourage good behaviours in them.
Even in these times that are so hard, there is hope that you can build strength, and when your children sense your love and appreciation, it helps them build their own strength, too. ü¶ã

Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn 2Ô∏è‚É£ simple tips that can help you encourage your children to build strength:

1Ô∏è‚É£ *INVOLVE YOUR CHILDREN*
2Ô∏è‚É£ *PRAISE THEM*
Here are 2Ô∏è‚É£ simple tips that can help you to encourage your children to build strength:

1Ô∏è‚É£ *INVOLVE YOUR CHILDREN*

Ask children to help in simple chores üí™. This will give them a sense of responsibility.

2Ô∏è‚É£ *PRAISE THEM*
üíôAppreciate children when they are trying or doing something good.

This will help them to do good again.

üåü Praising children shows them that you notice and care, and helps build confidence.

You can also build your own strength üí™ by remembering that you are not alone. 
Sharing your sorrow and worries with someone you trust often helps lighten the burden ü§ù. 

If your sorrow and worries feel overwhelming, please contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline. Type HELP after these tips for more information.
